data.title: Erlich (Reese) papers
data.text:
"Can You Dig It" factory newsletter April 1, 1972, etc.

Scope and Contents

Original factory newsletters written by Reese and workers at National Can Co., San Leandro. 1972-74 chronicles of workplace organizing.

#1 Afghanistan - Land mine clearing officials; land mine victims; Derrill Bodley in car (daughter died on 9/11; he is now deceased); victim of U.S. bombing; Mirwas Yasini, Afghan drug czar 2004

programs (DAT) award winning major radio documentaries

programs (DAT) award winning major radio documentaries

Unicef interview, refugees, two brothers who fought opposite sides of Angola civil war. One hour radio documentary, Children of War, reported by Charlayne Hunter Gault (PBS and CNN).

Asbestos mine workers; Marcos Lopes Martino, city councilman; Kubota factory; Luis Hafers, president Farmers Association of Brazil. Major investigative story on dangers of Brazilian asbestos; Brazil coffee story.

programs, domestic (DAT), 1988-1995

KQED story on US efforts to copy short term car rentals as seen in Europe. (See also Switzerland tapes 2000); Scott Sider, VP Hertz; Andrea Church, manager field operations; commuter interviews on BART.

programs (DAT) award winning major radio documentaries

Tour of Ayatollah Khomeini's house and compound, outside Tehran; Hassan Khomeini, grandson; Mani Haghighi, film director and actor; Hediyeh Tehrani, famous actress; interview with former president and 2005 candidate Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani; Hamid Reza Asefi, deputy foreign minister; women's rights demo in which Penn is roughed up.

Sinichi Arai, textbook critic; Akenori Takamori, Textbook Reform Associaiton; Ms. Terue Shinkawa, newspaper editor. Story about efforts to reform textbooks more critical of Japanese militarists WWII.

#53 Japan 7 - story on why Japanese women don't use birth control pills; Karin Amamiya, punk rocker and right winger 2001

Physical Description: 1 audiocassette(s)

Sources for story on why Japanese women don't use birth control pills; Karin Amamiya, punk rocker and right winger. Story on Japan's right wing youth movement; right wing rally; vox pop people at demo.

#8 Justice for Janitors - Union backed effort to improve wages/conditions for mostly Latino janitors in Silicon Valley

Physical Description: 1 audiocassette(s) (dat)

programs, domestic (DAT), 1988-1995

Bay Area interviews; Prof. John Kilgour; workers, SEIU officials. Union backed effort to improve wages/conditions for mostly Latino janitors in Silicon Valley.

Physical Description: 1 audiocassette(s)

Scope and Contents

programs, international (cassette copies), 1991-1996

Malaysia & Japan - April 2001. Medical clinic, students; AKoyan women; elementary school; Long Lawen Catholic Church; Liyau Anyi, headman. Story about self suffient small hyro electric project in rural Malaysian Borneo (Long Lawen).

Prof Tina Kennedy, environmental expert; architect Bill Kendricks; fire victims; first responders; victims of insurance companies. Original interviews and ambience of fire aftermath.

Doctors and arsenic victims, Daniel Gechter, Swiss scientist; story about water wells poisoned with arsenic, Allan Smith interviewed at UC Berkeley; UCB seatshop rally; Harley Shakin, UCB professor. Story on college sweatshop protest movement.

#4 First Monitor Radio broadcast exposing suppression of Mendes' story when he defied the Salazar government 1996-09-19

Physical Description: 1 audiocassette(s)

Scope and Contents

Aristides de Sousa Mendes, Portuguese holocaust hero. Erlich was one of the first American reporters to uncover his story. Cassettes include interviews with now deceased family members.

#6 Portuguese president honors Mendes - same story as #5 broadcast in short wave version 1987-05-22

Physical Description: 1 audiocassette(s)

Aristides de Sousa Mendes, Portuguese holocaust hero. Erlich was one of the first American reporters to uncover his story. Cassettes include interviews with now deceased family members.

International (cassettes), 1988-1994

1992 trip to Romania and Albania for CSM and Monitor Radio. Press conference of National Salvation Front; Petre Roman President NSF, prime minister 1989-91; story about homeless kids in Bucharest train station; Roma (Gypsy) member of parliament Raducanu Gheorghe; union leader Teodor Stetou.

programs (cassette), 1983-1994

1989 Trip to South Africa and Namibia for Monitor Radio. Erlich had to sneak in on a tourist visa and do clandestine interviews.

Physical Description: 1 audiocassette(s)

Scope and Contents

1989 Trip to South Africa and Namibia for Monitor Radio. Erlich had to sneak in on a tourist visa and do clandestine interviews.

Musicians; Robert Ilungo Numbi, Friends of Nelson Mandela; Cristofe Gbenzi, Lumumbaist; diamond traders. Story on smuggling diamonds.

Physical Description: 1 audiocassette(s)

Scope and Contents

International (cassettes), 1988-1994

Dirk Mudge, South African colonial administrator of Nambia, press conference in which Erlich challenged his statements and made the front page of the next day's newspaper. Interviews: Bishop Hendrick Fredrich, Elly Shipiki, student leader who became an administrator for the city of Windhoek; Marco Haisikou, who later became Foreign Minister and Deputy Prime Minister; Able Gower.
